metadata.name: A-Story Tutorial: Personal Search
metadata.description: Authored A-story tutorial scenes establishing the personal search narrative - carrying mentor's journal, seeking scattered colleagues who remember
metadata.author: Wayfarer Team

sceneTemplates.introNarrativeTemplate: You arrive in the evening, road-worn and carrying little besides your mentor's journal. The pages are filled with half-finished thoughts, questions without answers, and names of people scattered across regions you've never visited. Elena's name appears several times - old friend, the notes say. Knew them well in the early years. You push open the inn door, hoping she might remember.

Elena mentioned {NPCName} - someone your mentor knew in later years. The journal has their name too, just once, with a note: 'different perspective, uncomfortable questions.' You find them at {LocationName}, uncertain how they'll receive you or what they'll remember.

Two people, two different memories of the same events. Elena spoke warmly of shared work, easy friendship. {PreviousNPCName} described tension, unspoken disagreements, a friendship that frayed. Your mentor's journal offers no clarity - just more questions, more names. The trail leads to {LocationName}, where older records might hold answers. Or more complications.
